faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: Practical classes in analytical chemistry. The focus is on giving the students practical experience on using different labware and on simple chemical analysis methods: gravimetry, different titration methods,simple instrumental analysis methods  and sample preparation. Metrological aspects (calibration, measurement uncertainty, etc) of analytical chemistry also are involved.
description.et: Analüütilise keemia praktikum algajatele. Fookuses on anda tudengile praktilised kogemused erinevate lihtsamate keemiliste analüüside läbiviimiseks. Metroloogilised aspektid on kursusesse kaasatud.

objectives.en: Supporting the theoretical knowledge studied in lecture with practical aspects. To give the students basic practical knowledge about the most common chemical analysis methods and the basic skills to carry out chemical analyses (both manual work and data treatment). Oral self-expression skills are improved.
objectives.et: Toetada loengus omandatut teooriat praktiliste oskustega. Pakkuda võimalust omandada alusteadmised töötamisest analüütilise keemia laboris. Toetada õppijate suulise eneväljendusoskuse arengut. Õppija arendab keemiliste analüüside läbiviimisega vajalikke õpioskusi (vajalikud töövõtted ja andmetöötlusoskused).

learning_outcomes.en: *	the principles and applications of gravimetric, potentiometric and titrimetric analysis;
learning_outcomes.et: *	Gravimeetrilise ja tiitrimeetrilise analüüsi põhimõtteid ja rakendusi;

learning_outcomes.en: *	the basics of sample preparation in chemical analysis;
*	the principles of the simple instrumental analysis.
*	correctly use the basic analytical chemistry labware (pipettes, volumetric flasks, burettes, balances, magnetic stirrers, heating equipment etc);
learning_outcomes.et: *	korrektselt kasutama põhilisi töövahendeid analüütilise keemia laboris (kaalud, pipetid, büretid, kolvid, magnetsegajad jne);

learning_outcomes.en: *	perform weighing and preparing solutions correctly;
learning_outcomes.et: *	viima läbi kaalumist ja valmistama lahuseid korrektselt;

learning_outcomes.en: *	carry out basic sample preparation for analysis
*	carry out chemical analysis, prepare appropriate report and calculate results for gravimetric, titrimetric and simple instrumental analysis.
learning_outcomes.et: *	viima läbi lihtsamat keemilist  analüüsi (ka instrumentaalmeetoditel, koostama mõõtmiste kohta protokolli ja arvutama saadud mõõtmiste alusel tulemusi.

independent_work.et:
All instructions are given in Moodle.
The list of practical tasks:
1. Calibration of glassware
2. Acid-base titration, potentiometric titration.
3. Redox titration
4. Surprise work
5. UV-Vis spectroscopy (photometry)
6. Atomic emission spectroscopy
7. High performance liquid chromatography
8. Complexometric titration

grade_preconditions.et:
Before each practical work student has to make acquaintance with instructions (downloadable in Moodle) and the theory of particular work to perform it. Student first prepares preliminary report using the synthetic data given to each practical work in Moodle. This data can be found in Precalculation test data and this test must be passed before student can come to the practical work. Additionally, student answers theoretical questions of particular work from supervisor before performing practical task. All practical works must be performed safely. After performing practical task student prepares experiment report (previously constructed preliminary report can be used for  this) with experiment description, experimental data and calculation of the results. Experimental data, which is obtained during practical work is treated according to instructions and the report is submitted via Moodle system. Feedback is given for all reports and corrections will be done if needed within one week after performing practical task.
Passing all practical works and acceptance of all experimental reports is prerequisite to pass to practical exam.

grade_evaluation.et: For passing the course: If all practical works have been completed and reports accepted, then it is possible to participate independent practical task. This means that a student gets instructions of practical task and performes it independent and safely using the correct technics with labware and instruments. Student calculates the result and submits the report. Every student is followed by two assessors and pass or fail is an outcome of evaluation matrix (available in Moodle).

resources.mandatory_materials:
1. Lecture notes of "Practical Chemical Analysis" LOKT.06.032
2. Skoog D.A., West D.M., Holler F.J. Fundamentals of Analytical Chemistry. Sixth edition, Saunders College 1992 or newer.
3. Skoog D.A., Holler F.J., Nieman T.A. Principles of Instrumental Analysis. Fifth edition, Harcourt Brace 1998 or newer.
